title.narrative: Training process for peasant families to defend the environment in their communities

description.narrative: This project is part of the third party support mechanism included in the EU funded project for human rights defenders in Latin America (ICD1016). Nicaragua is facing a political, social and economic crisis since 2018. The weak institutionality and polarisation have impacted in the productives and food systems. This initiative adresses to relevant issues in the Dry Corridor of Nicaragua, mainly related to the lack of access to land, food security and quality water. The current development model promotes extractives industries in this region increasing the vulnerabilities facing the climate change and an inappropriate natural resources management. These issues have been deepen by the hurricanes ETA and IOTA that affected the country during last year. The planned activities will provide training to social leaders and information to rural communitie inspired in the related legal framework but also in the encyclicals "Laudato Si" and "Fratelli tutti". During the process, the use of ICT will be encouraged to influence in the public opinion, promoting cultural changes. In addition, efforts will be joined with local networks for the defence of the environment, aimed to non-deforestation, water sanitation, adaptation to climate change, agroecological practices and women´s empowerment.
